title: "sql: no rows in result set" error on login accounts after scanning sync QR while logged into existing account
body:
**Steps:** 

1. Login multiaccount
2. Go to Profile - Syncing - plus - Scan or enter sync code
3. Scan valid sync code
4. Observe the result

**Actual result:** 

1. User gets stucked on Syncing page. 
2. After app re-opening there is synced account in the list of accounts. Attempt to login synced account results in ```sql: no rows in result set``` error. After that user will face the same error on logging all the existing accounts

[Status-debug-logs (56).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/12595784/Status-debug-logs.56.zip)

![photo_2023-09-13 12 20 01](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/97245802/d9604fd7-64c5-4a33-af67-676718305c12)

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/97245802/89a72548-72c1-4723-91d0-055d1094031e



### Additional Information

- Status version: nightly, release 1.25
- Operating System: Android, iOS


[comment]: # (Please, add logs/notes if necessary)

> From the video, @pavloburykh has initiated pairing from another profile.

that's correct.

Thank you @smohamedjavid .

The `geth.log` doesn't seem to contain any errors related to pairing, so is it possible that the node logging in and out is causing a problem?

> The geth.log doesn't seem to contain any errors related to pairing, so is it possible that the node logging in and out is causing a problem?

More likely, yes. I will try to debug it in a while (with more logs) to confirm it.

@pavloburykh can I confirm the expected process flow:

1. Device 1 creates Account A
1. Device 1 creates Account B
1. Device 2 locally pairs and syncs Account A
1. Device 2 logs into Account A
1. Device 1 logs into Account B
1. Device 1 prepares local pairing QR code for Account B
1. Device 2, while still logged into Account A, prepares to sync and pair Account B
1. Device 1 sends Account B data to Device 2
1. Device 2 receives Account B data
1. Device 2 logs into Account B

Hi @Samyoul! Here are more detailed steps and expected result. Sorry if steps in the [description](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/issues/17270#issue-1894116927) appeared to be confusing. 

**Steps:**

1. Device 1 logs into Account 1 
2. Device 2 logs into Account 2
3. Device 2 Generates sync QR of Account 2
4. Device 1 scans generated Account 2 sync code while being logged into Account 1

**Expected result:** 
1. Device 2 sends Account 2 data to Device 1
2. Device 1 receives Account 2 data
3. Device 1 is automatically logged into Account 2 when sync process is finished

so as far as I see it is flow with syncing invalid QR (which doesn't belong to the same user)

In this case the priority of this issue is lower. 

@pavloburykh can I ask you to re-check it on QRs for the same account on different devices to make them sync?

thanks!

Thank you @pavloburykh. Do you know when the last time this process flow was tested?

@churik you mentioned that the usual process flow is syncing pre-existing accounts. I wonder if the fix for this issue is to introduce a check that the account being synced matches the account the user is logged into. Then return an error if the user tries to sync and pair an other account while still logged in.
